intro: Anthemis canescens, commonly known as white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are grayish-green and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and white or pale yellow. It is often used in herbal medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
